abstract: The hedge fund manager reduced his holdings in the two big banks, as analysts and investors have largely concluded that financial firms’ outsize post-crisis profits are over.
snippet: The hedge fund manager reduced his holdings in the two big banks, as analysts and investors have largely concluded that financial firms’ outsize post-crisis profits are over.
lead_paragraph: For much of the post-crisis recovery, John A. Paulson has bet big on the nation’s banks, wagering that with the worst of the financial meltdown behind us, the sector was full of promise.

headline.main: Paulson Cuts Bets on Bank of America and Citi
